thread.title: Spare the Air alert issued for Friday in Bay Area
thread.title_full: Spare the Air alert issued for Friday in Bay Area

author: BAY CITY NEWS SERVICE
title: Spare the Air alert issued for Friday in Bay Area
text:
Editor's Pick Spare the Air alert, wood burning ban in effect Friday in Bay Area BAY CITY NEWS SERVICE Dec 19, 2024 Dec 19, 2024 Updated 13 mins ago 0 Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save 7 Day Forecast Thursday 56° / 41° Friday 60° / 46° Saturday 57° / 50° Sunday 61° / 54° Monday 62° / 54° Tuesday 58° / 40° Wednesday 59° / 45° A Spare the Air alert has been issued for Friday, banning wood burning in Napa County and the Bay Area because of a forecast for unhealthy pollution levels, regional air quality officials said.
The Bay Area Air Quality Management District issued the alert because of pollution from local wood burning and air pollution coming into the region from the Central Valley that, combined with light winds and cold temperatures, will lead to unhealthy air quality on Friday.
Listen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts
On Spare the Air days during the winter season, the burning of wood, manufactured fire logs or any other solid fuel is banned outdoors or in indoor fireplaces, pellet stoves or other wood-burning devices. Exemptions are available for homes without permanently installed heating, according to the air district.
Air district officials say exposure to wood smoke, which contains carcinogenic substances, has been linked to serious respiratory illnesses and the increased risk of heart attacks.
People are also reading… Napa teacher placed on leave again following 2022 Dixon incident Battle drags on over day care center planned for Napa’s Alta Heights area Update: No danger found after hazmat report near Napa High School, authorities say Three arrested after robbery at Napa's Ulta Beauty store 25 rescued Chihuahuas to find new homes, but not in Napa County CIF State 5-A Football Championship: American Canyon runs past Palmdale 68-47 for title Mayacamas Charter Middle School’s test scores from first year prompts disappointment and tension at meeting Chicken Guy! scheduled to open Thursday in American Canyon St. Helena's Flora Springs acquired by Gina and Jean-Charles Boisset Rory’s Bakehouse opens retail window on Old Sonoma Road in Napa Be Bubbly Napa to close downtown Napa space, refocus business Top 10 stories of 2024, No. 10: Napa native Brock Bowers makes NFL history as rookie Raiders star Saturday Napa Farmers Market canceled Napa County Board of Supervisors says farewell to Gregory, Pedroza Man arrested on manslaughter, DUI allegations after fatal Napa County crash People who violate the wood burning ban for the first time are encouraged to take a wood smoke awareness course or will face a $100 ticket. Second violations can lead to a $500 ticket, with the amount increasing for any subsequent violations, according to the air district.
